modules.description: Handles the generation of Fish shell tab completion scripts. It works with command-line argument specifications to produce completion logic, using a formatter to output the generated script. Useful for creating interactive CLI tools with Fish shell support.

Handles command-line argument parsing by defining flags and their behaviors. Works with lists of tuples representing flag names, parsing specifications, and help messages. Useful for building command-line interfaces where flags trigger actions like file input handling or configuration setting.

Generates Bash completion scripts for command-line interfaces. It takes a list of command-line options along with their specifications and descriptions, and outputs the corresponding Bash completion code to the given formatter. This module is used to automate shell tab completion for CLI tools written in OCaml.

Handles command-line argument parsing and help generation for Zsh scripts. Works with lists of tuples containing argument names, specifications, and descriptions. Used to define and document command-line interfaces with custom options and usage messages.

This module provides functionality for defining command-line interfaces and generating shell completion scripts. It works with lists of tuples representing command-line flags, their parsing specifications, and descriptions, along with formatters for outputting shell code. Concrete use cases include building CLI tools with support for Bash, Fish, and Zsh tab completion, and handling flag-based configuration and input parsing.
